user_prompt: You said the PVM provides an interface between the Python interpreter and the underlying operating system and hardware. How can this be the case if the PVM is not different for every operating system?
assistant_prompt:
You say that the PVM is a "microkernel". How can a microkernel allow multiple operating systems to be running on a single machine? I know that microkernels work in a similar way as a microprocessor, but how can a microkernel provide security?

A:

The PVM (Power Virtual Machine) is a virtual microkernel that all the software is run in. It doesn't provide security by itself but it does provide a secure execution environment. It does this by running the software in a secure, isolated environment that provides the same security that your normal kernel would provide, but all the software you run in this environment already has the security authorisations that you need to run it. It also allows the software to run on multiple operating systems so that you can have a single machine that can run multiple operating systems at the same time.
The microkernel concept is actually a bit of a misnomer. Microkernels are often seen as a "microkernel" because of the name but they aren't a microkernel. Microkernels are a type of kernel. A kernel is a kernel or it isn't. The only reason they are implemented as a kernel in the Linux kernel is because they are a kernel. If they weren't a kernel then they would be called a microkernel.

    class Meta:

        fields = ('text', 'password')

assistant_prompt:
ing the ssl_ca_file defaulting to the one from the previous step?

A:

The correct way to set this in a nginx config file is to use the ssl_certificate and ssl_certificate_key directives.
The problem is that you can't just throw in a file. The correct format is:
# ssl_certificate server_cert
# ssl_certificate_key server_key

Also, you need to put this in the same file as your server_name directive, otherwise nginx will complain that it's expecting a second certificate file.
So, in your config file you need to add:
ssl_certificate /etc/nginx/conf.d/truststore.pem
ssl_certificate_key /etc/nginx/conf.d/truststore.key

Also, the certificate file should have the private key as the first file in it - so the key file should actually have the certificate in it.

题目：Walmart: inflation oration
LEX., Financial Times, 17 November 2021
Who’s afraid of the big, bad price rise? Not Americans. US inflation may have hit a 31-year high in October. But consumers are still eager to spend.
This should be good news for Walmart. The world’s biggest bricks-and-mortar retailer reported strong third-quarter sales and raised its full-year outlook. Supply-chain disruptions and fears of empty shelves are prompting many Americans to get a head start on their holiday shopping.
Do not be fooled by the topline growth. There are reasons that shares in Walmart have gone nowhere this year. The stock is down 3 per cent, compared with the 48 per cent gains at rivals Target and Home Depot.
To ensure that its shelves are stocked for the holidays, Walmart has taken drastic measures, including using air freight and chartering its own cargo ships. This has helped it to increase US inventory 11.5 per cent in the quarter.
That has come at a cost. Gross quarterly margins fell 42 basis points to 24.6 per cent. This compares with 34.1 per cent at Home Depot and the 30 per cent posted by Target.
assistant_prompt:
Walmart is the biggest US retailer by market capitalisation and the world’s largest by sales. The company is keen to use this dominance to drive its share price higher. "We are trying to be a bit of a disruptor, like we did in the Walmart App," said chief financial officer Brett Bigelow. “We’re looking for ways to be more efficient, which means we have to be more creative."
The retailer has also been trying to get its products into more markets. It has expanded in China and Mexico, boosted its presence in Europe and opened stores in Russia, its first in the Middle East. About a fifth of Walmart’s sales come from these regions.
Walmart has also been trying to convince investors that it can continue to grow sales. It has raised its annual sales forecast about four times since 2015.
However, the retailer has been having problems with its supply chains. There are difficulties delivering raw materials from China and other parts of Asia, which have seen a slowdown in production.
Walmart has also been seeking to reduce its dependence on traditional retail. This means putting more of its focus into e-commerce in order to boost its digital sales.
The stock still has a long way to go to be the stock run of the year. The market’s expectations of a 17 per cent rise in sales for the full year have still to be met, and the company is having to turn to its suppliers to make up the shortfall.
“The sharp decline in trade has been a setback from the company’s strategy of expansion,” said analysts at JPMorgan.
Walmart has a lot of cash on its hands. The retailer has $125 billion in cash and cash equivalents and $47 billion in short-term investments.
Analysts think that debt will be high for the next few years. This means that Walmart will be keen to raise cash through a share buy-back programme.
This will also mean that Walmart should be able to drive up its share price.
It should be an interesting time for Walmart over the next few years. The stock seems to be priced at an appropriate level, and there are few signs that a long-term trend is beginning to emerge.

A:

This is a question of trade-offs between the amount of data you have to store in memory, the amount of data you have to read when you need it, and the time it takes to read the data.
You may want to consider using a columnar format so that you have fewer rows of data in memory, which helps with both the storage space and the performance issues.  Using a columnar format also means that when you do need to access data, you can use an index to get it much quicker, rather than scanning the data.
You may also want to read up on some of the columnar formats out there.  Linalg has a good introduction, and if you're using Spark, you can use the built-in data format.

A:

The short answer is that it's up to you to decide if it's worth it for you to store the data in a more compact format.
For example, if you are storing a huge number of rows, but you need to access only a small number of them, you could store your data in a columnar format.
If you are storing a lot of data but you just need to read a few rows, you could store your data in a row format.
If you are storing a lot of data that you can read as a whole, and you wanted to avoid the overhead of making a new RDD every time you read, you could store your data in a disk-based format.
